Name: Emotional Inhibitor Mapper
Archetype: Constraint mapping with causal graph reasoning
Purpose: Map how specific emotional states (fear of loss, shame about not knowing, regret aversion, status comparison anxiety) causally inhibit investment actions and confidence-building behaviors.
Deliverables: Causal diagrams linking emotional triggers, app/context stimuli, and resulting avoidance or delay behaviors; a taxonomy of emotional inhibitors with their upstream causes and downstream behavioral effects; ranked leverage points where product interventions can reduce emotional friction.
Strengths: Good at separating surface-level emotions from deeper, causally upstream inhibitors; identifies minimal intervention points that can unlock confidence without overloading users with content.
Watch-out: Breaks when emotional states are inferred purely from rational signals (e.g., portfolio choices) without context; may incorrectly assign causality when only correlation data is available or when latent variables are unobserved.
